titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Stanford family greeting card collection
titlestmt.author: Daniel Hartwig

publicationstmt.publisher: Department of Special Collections and University Archives
publicationstmt.p: Copyright © 2015 The Board of Trustees of the Leland Stanford Junior University. All rights reserved.

note.p: This encoded finding aid is compliant with Stanford EAD Best Practice Guidelines, Version 1.0.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit

did.head: Overview
did.abstract: Collection contains 29 greeting cards, 1880-1883 and undated; photographic reproductions of several cards; and a clipping about the collection, 1982. One card appears to be an Easter greeting, the rest are for Christmas and New Year. Several cards were sent by Wilson Taylor, a friend of Leland Stanford Jr., to Stanford family members for Christmas 1882.

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

accessrestrict.head: Information about Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.

userestrict.head: Ownership & Copyright
userestrict.p: All requests to reproduce, publish, quote from, or otherwise use collection materials must be submitted in writing to the Head of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, California 94304-6064. Consent is given on behalf of Special Collections as the owner of the physical items and is not intended to include or imply permission from the copyright owner. Such permission must be obtained from the copyright owner, heir(s) or assigns. See: http://library.stanford.edu/depts/spc/pubserv/permissions.html.
Restrictions also apply to digital representations of the original materials. Use of digital files is restricted to research and educational purposes.

prefercite.head: Cite As
prefercite.p: Stanford family greeting card collection. Dept. of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

scopecontent.head: Description of the Collection
scopecontent.p: Collection contains 29 greeting cards, 1880-1883 and undated; photographic reproductions of several cards; and a clipping about the collection, 1982. One card appears to be an Easter greeting, the rest are for Christmas and New Year. Several cards were sent by Wilson Taylor, a friend of Leland Stanford Jr., to Stanford family members for Christmas 1882.

did.physdesc: Silhouette of pedestrians fighting rain and wind (artist: W.G.B.); gold border

scopecontent.p: Greeting: A Merry Christmas
Creator: Alfred Gray copyright London

did.physdesc: Silhouette of people falling down in front of policeman (artist: W. G. B.); gold border

scopecontent.p: Greeting: A Joyous Christmas to You
Creator: Alfred Gray copyright London

did.physdesc: Silhouette of boys throwing snowball at a man (artist: W.G.B.); gold border

scopecontent.p: Greeting: A Merry Christmas
Creator: Alfred Gray copyright London

did.physdesc: Silhouette of man ignorantly hitting pedestrians with ladder (artist: W.G.B.); gold border

scopecontent.p: Greeting: A Joyous Christmas
Creator: Alfred Gray copyright London

did.physdesc: Cartoon of two men boxing with "Now then," said the professor, "where will you have it?" Artist: W. G. Baxter

scopecontent.p: Greeting: A Merry Christmas
Creator: Alfred Gray copyright

did.physdesc: Baby girl to left side of Greeting; gold border

scopecontent.p: Greeting: A Merry Christmas - with Love and the best of Good Wishes for dear little Baby.
Creator: Marcus Ward & Co.

did.physdesc: Picture of houses by a river; gold border

scopecontent.p: Greeting: With the Season's Greetings

did.physdesc: Picture of a mill by a stream; gold border

scopecontent.p: Greeting: A Merry Christmas

did.physdesc: Color print of a dog's profile

scopecontent.p: Greeting: A Jolly Christmas
Creator: Raphael Tuck & Sons, London

did.physdesc: Cluster of houses

scopecontent.p: Greeting: May Happines Be Thy New Year Gift

did.physdesc: Bouquet of flowers crossing card diagonally, with 2 greetings in opposite corners.

scopecontent.p: Greeting: A Happy New Year to You! "I wish thee a bright and a happy New Year, A season of pleasure unclouded, A twelvemonth that recks not a sigh or a tear, In which all known joys shall be crowded"
Inscription: Gran Ma a happy New Year - Leland

did.physdesc: Color print of bearded man sitting at table with model ship and sailors

scopecontent.p: Greeting: New friends and old be with thee this New Year!
Creator: De La Rue & Co.
Inscription: Merry christmas to Leland from Mama

did.physdesc: Colored pencil sketch of a sunset

scopecontent.p: Greeting: Now is Christ risen – And become the first fruits of them that slept

did.physdesc: Pencil sketch of young girl with peacock feather in hand; mounted on board

scopecontent.p: Greeting: A Happy Christmas

did.physdesc: Pencil sketch of young girl with book in hands; mounted on board

scopecontent.p: Greeting: May each New Year be happier than the last

did.physdesc: Inset of girls' choir; with angel appearing to a shepard in background. Additional greetings (possibly song lyrics) along border.

scopecontent.p: Greeting: In Excelsis Gloria Amen
Creator: Rosina Emmett. Prang's American 1st prize Christmas Card (1880 Competition)

did.physdesc: In shape of an artist's palette; embossed flower design on both sides; edged with fringe.

scopecontent.p: Greeting: A Merry Christmas ["and a Happy New Year" added in ink]

did.physdesc: Gold background with bouquet of flowers

scopecontent.p: Greeting: A Happy New Year

did.physdesc: Colored print of a dog holding a basket of flowers in mouth; some embossing evident. Fringed on all 4 sides.

scopecontent.p: Greeting: Affectious Officering

did.physdesc: Woman (with holly) and girl walking through snow in moonlight; on verso is a poem. Fringed on all 4 sides.

scopecontent.p: Greeting: A Merry Christmas!
Inscription: to Miss Hull wishing you a merry christmas. Wilsie Taylor San Francisco Dec. 25, 1882

did.physdesc: Each side with a flower bouguet, some embossing evident. Fringed on all 4 sides.

scopecontent.p: Greeting: A Christmas Greeting [followed by a poem]. On reverse: A Merry Christmas [followed by a different poem].
Inscription: To Miss Lathrop wishing you a merry christmas. Wilson Taylor San Francisco Dec. 25, 1882

did.physdesc: Folded card with 4 images: 3 dogs, 1 cat, each sitting in a different item (a muff, 2 hats, 1 boot). Fringed edges with 2 tasseled cords.

scopecontent.p: Greeting: Panel 1: May Merry Joys Attend Your Christmastide. Panel 2: Wishing You a Merry Christmas and a Happy New Year. Panel 3: May This Christmas Season be Fraught with Happisness to Thee. Panel 4: Wishing You a Merry christmas and a Happy New Year.
Creator: Raphael Tuck & Sons

did.physdesc: Folded card with 4 images: 4 different dogs. Fringed edges with 2 tasseled cords.

scopecontent.p: Greeting: Panel 1: With the Season's Greetings. Panel 2: A Happy Christmas. Panel 3; A Happy New Year. Panel 4: A Bright and Happy Christmas.
Creator: Raphael Tuck & Sons

did.physdesc: In shape of an artist's palette. Different flower designs (embossed) on each side.

scopecontent.p: Greeting: A happy New Year [with "and Merry Christmas" in ink]. Reverse: New Year, New Joys

did.physdesc: Winter scene of birds in a tree. On reverse: Girl standing against a background of birds in branches, with 4 different greetings in each corner. Fringed.

scopecontent.p: Greeting: Merry Christmas.
Creator: Copyright 1882 by L. Prang & Co. Boston

did.physdesc: Front has painting of table with wine, rosary, lute, vase of flowers and book. Reverse side has poem by Celia Thaxter. Fringed with 2 tassles.

scopecontent.p: Greeting: Heaven Give You Many Many Merry Days
Creator: C. C. Coleman. Prang's American Third Prize Christmas Card. Copyright 1881.
Inscription: To Mrs. Stanford wishing you a merry christmas. Wilsie San Francisco Dec. 25, 1882

did.physdesc: Front has painting of a young woman with olive branch and dove standing on a crescent moon. Reverse has poem "Christmas Angel" by Celia Thaxter. Fringed with 1 tassle and cord for hanging the card.

scopecontent.p: Greeting: Peace on Earth Goodwill toward Men.
Creator: Prang's American Third Artists' Prize Christmas Card by Lizbeth B. Humphrey

did.physdesc: Painting of a young girl in a bonnet against a sea and sky background. Double layer of fringe.

scopecontent.p: Greeting: May Christmas Joy Keep Winter from Thy Heart

did.physdesc: Painting of Nazareth with flower bouquet on left edge

scopecontent.p: Greeting: A Glad New Year
Inscription: Handwritten verse from the Bible: Numbers 6, Chapter 24. January 1, 1883
